thread.title: Caitlyn Jenner won't be charged in fatal crash
thread.title_full: Caitlyn Jenner won't be charged in fatal crash

author:
Compiled by Martha Ross

mross@bayareanewsgroup.com
title: Caitlyn Jenner won't be charged in fatal crash
text:
Caitlyn Jenner won't be charged in fatal crash Compiled by Martha Ross Posted: 09/30/2015 01:27:28 PM PDT Updated: 09/30/2015 01:27:28 PM PDT Caitlyn Jenner won't be prosecuted for vehicular manslaughter or other charges in a fatal February car crash on the Pacific Coast Highway. 
The Associated Press reported Wednesday that prosecutors found there wasn't enough evidence to convict Jenner in the multivehicle accident that led to the death of another driver. 
"We believed from the start that a thorough and objective investigation would clear Caitlyn of any criminal wrongdoing," said Blair Berk, Jenner's attorney. "We are heartened the district attorney has agreed that even a misdemeanor charge would be inappropriate. A traffic accident, however devastating and heartbreaking when a life is lost, is not necessarily a criminal matter." 
Authorities said Jenner, 65, was towing an off-road vehicle on a trailer behind a Cadillac Escalade when she crashed into two cars, pushing one into oncoming traffic. Driver Kim Howe was killed when her Lexus was hit by a Hummer. 
The accident occurred as Jenner was becoming a pop culture icon for coming out as a transgender woman. 
Sheriff's investigators previously determined that Jenner was traveling at an unsafe speed for the road conditions at the time, and there was enough evidence to support a vehicular manslaughter charge. The case was referred to the district attorney's major crimes division. 
Jenner, however, is not entirely off the hook for the accident. She is facing separate lawsuits by Howe's stepchildren and the driver of the other car involved in the collision. Advertisement
